concise_definition: n. 暴食, 暴饮; v. 暴食, 暴饮, 沉迷

definitions.explanation_en: A period of excessive and uncontrolled consumption of food, drink, or other substances, often in a short time frame.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在短时间内对食物、饮料或其他物质进行过度且失控的消费。
definitions.example_en: After weeks of dieting, she had a binge on chocolate and ice cream.
definitions.example_cn: 经过几周的节食后，她大吃了一顿巧克力和冰淇淋。

definitions.explanation_en: A prolonged and intense period of engaging in an activity, especially watching television or using digital media, often to the exclusion of other responsibilities.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指长时间、高强度地从事某项活动，尤其是连续观看电视节目或使用数字媒体，常忽视其他责任。
definitions.example_en: He spent the weekend on a binge-watching marathon of the entire series.
definitions.example_cn: 他整个周末都在连续追完整部剧集。

definitions.explanation_en: To consume something excessively and uncontrollably, especially food, alcohol, or media content.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指过度且失控地消费某物，尤指食物、酒精或媒体内容。
definitions.example_en: They binged on pizza and soda during the movie night.
definitions.example_cn: 他们在电影之夜大吃披萨和苏打水。

definitions.explanation_en: To engage in an activity intensively and continuously over a short period, often to excess.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在短时间内高强度、连续地从事某项活动，常达到过度的程度。
definitions.example_en: She binged on Netflix for three days straight during her vacation.
definitions.example_cn: 她在假期里连续三天沉迷于看Netflix。

comparison.analysis: “Overeat”（吃得过多）仅指摄入食物超过正常量，语义范围较窄，不涉及其他行为或媒体消费。而 “binge” 不仅可用于饮食，还可用于观看视频、购物、游戏等，强调一种失控的、成瘾性的行为模式。
“Indulge”（放纵）通常带有自愿享受、适度纵容的意味，不一定失控或有害，如“indulge in a treat”（犒赏自己）。而 “binge” 隐含过度、缺乏节制甚至自我伤害的负面含义，更强调行为的极端性和非理性。
“Consume”（消费）是一个中性词，泛指使用或消耗资源（如能源、信息、商品），无程度或情感色彩。而 “binge” 是一种特定类型的消费，强调数量巨大、时间集中、失去控制，具有强烈的行为特征和心理倾向。
